crop.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a plant such as wheat, rice, or fruit that is grown by farmers and used as food
crop.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The main crops were oats and barley.
crop.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the amount of wheat, rice, fruit etc that is produced in a season
crop.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Fruit growers are gathering in a bumper crop  (=a very large amount of something produced in a season).
this season’s crop of quality pears
crop.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a short whip used in horse-riding
crop.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the part under a bird’s throat where food is stored
crop.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Many crops are grown from seed every year.
Farmers burn their fields in preparation for planting crops.
Brazil's coffee crop begins to be harvested in May.
The land is so poor that much of the seed will not produce a crop.
Crops are sometimes rotated with grass.
When disease destroyed the crop, famine followed.
The drought meant the crops failed and food was scarce.
In January farmers prepare the ground for the potato crop.
The demand for ethanol has reduced the amount of corn grown as a food crop.
Cotton is grown as a cash crop in the savannah.
A lot of woodland has been cleared for arable crops.
He argues that genetically modified crops are needed to avoid future famines.
staple crops such as rice and wheat
Cocoa is the country's main export crop.
The area is mostly unsuitable for crop production.
The storms caused crop damage across the country.
Crop rotation helps build up soil fertility.
crop.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Stella’s had her hair closely cropped.
crop.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to cut a part off a photograph or picture so that it is a particular size or shape
crop.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if an animal crops grass or other plants, it makes them short by eating them
crop.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: if a plant crops, it produces fruit, grain etc
crop.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: My strawberries crop in June or July.
crop.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a plant such as wheat, rice, or fruit that is grown by farmers in order to be eaten or used in industry
crop.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The main crop in China is rice.
crop.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: the amount of wheat, rice, fruit etc that is produced in a season
crop.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Wheat farmers have had a record crop this year.
